text: MS does have a number of people here in Cambridge, MA (they even tried to take over the building at One Memorial Drive, which is the world headquarters of InterSystems, where I used to work :slightly_smiling_face: )

text: I think the package above refers to Cambridge (UK)?

elements.text: I think the package above refers to Cambridge (UK)?

text: I didn’t see any reference to Cambridge, UK, in the package, and the Interactive Media Group seems to be out of Redmond, but one of the principal people is from Cambridge, UK.

text: the author of the package is in UK timezone and there is a Microsft Research Lab in Cambridge (UK): <https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/lab/microsoft-research-cambridge/>

elements.text: the author of the package is in UK timezone and there is a Microsft Research Lab in Cambridge (UK):

text: the Microsoft Research lab in Cambridge UK hosted Mike Innes for a talk on Zygote a year or two ago as well (I was thinking of going but ended up missing it). So they at least had some Julia interest then

text: Nice! I think any research oriented company or division of a company that isn’t seriously looking into Julia by now, must have their collective heads in the sand :laughing:
